Text: O LORD, You have searched me and known me.
Context: The psalmist expresses a sense of comfort and awe that God knows him completely.

Text: You know when I sit and when I rise; You understand my thoughts from afar.
Context: The psalmist marvels at God’s intimate knowledge of his daily actions and thoughts.

Text: You search out my path and my lying down; You are aware of all my ways.
Context: The psalmist acknowledges God‘s thorough knowledge of his life.

Text: Even before a word is on my tongue, You know all about it, O LORD.
Context: The psalmist is amazed by God’s ability to know his words even before he speaks.

Text: You hem me in behind and before; You have laid Your hand upon me.
Context: The psalmist feels God‘s protective presence around him.

Text: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me, too lofty for me to attain.
Context: The psalmist is overwhelmed by the depth of God’s knowledge and finds it beyond his understanding.

Text: Where can I go to escape Your Spirit? Where can I flee from Your presence?
Context: The psalmist ponders the inescapability of God‘s presence.

Text: If I ascend to the heavens, You are there; if I make my bed in Sheol, You are there.
Context: The psalmist expresses confidence in God’s omnipresence.

Text: If I rise on the wings of the dawn, if I settle by the farthest sea,
Context: The psalmist considers the vastness of the world and God‘s presence in every location.

Text: even there Your hand will guide me; Your right hand will hold me fast.
Context: The psalmist feels assured of God’s guidance and protection everywhere he goes.

Text: If I say, ”Surely the darkness will hide me, and the light become night around me“—
Context: The psalmist contemplates the possibility of darkness hiding him from God.

Text: even the darkness is not dark to You, but the night shines like the day, for darkness is as light to You.
Context: The psalmist realizes that darkness cannot conceal him from God, which brings him hope.

Text: For You formed my inmost being; You knit me together in my mother‘s womb.
Context: The psalmist praises God for His intimate involvement in his creation.

Text: I praise You, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made. Wonderful are Your works, and my soul knows it very well.
Context: The psalmist expresses joy and wonder at the fact that God made him and all His works are wonderful.

Text: My frame was not hidden from You when I was made in secret, when I was woven together in the depths of the earth.
Context: The psalmist reflects on God’s knowledge of his formation before he was born.

Text: Your eyes saw my unformed body; all my days were written in Your book and ordained before one of them came to be.
Context: The psalmist finds security in knowing that God had a plan for his life before he was even born.

Text: How precious to me are Your thoughts, O God, how vast is the sum of them!
Context: The psalmist expresses affection for God and marvels at the vastness of His thoughts.

Text: If I were to count them, they would outnumber the grains of sand; when I awake, I am still with You.
Context: The psalmist is grateful for God‘s countless thoughts and finds comfort in God’s constant presence.

Text: If only You would slay the wicked, O God—away from me, you bloodthirsty men—
Context: The psalmist expresses anguish over the presence of wicked people and wishes for God to take action against them.

Text: who invoke You deceitfully; Your enemies take Your name in vain.
Context: The psalmist is disgusted by those who misuse God‘s name and who are enemies against Him.

Text: Do I not hate those who hate You, O LORD, and abhor those who rise against You?
Context: The psalmist expresses his disapproval and detestation for those who hate God.

Text: I hate them with perfect hatred; I count them as my enemies.
Context: The psalmist feels an intense animosity towards God’s enemies, considering them as his own enemies.

Text: Search me, O God, and know my heart; test me and know my anxious thoughts.
Context: The psalmist asks for God‘s examination of his heart and thoughts, displaying openness to God’s scrutiny.

Text: See if there is any offensive way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
Context: The psalmist invites God to reveal any wrong in him and desires to be led in the path of eternal righteousness.
